paper.title: New Trends in Treating Cushing's Disease

entities.name: LOGICS
synonyms: A study to assess the safety and efficacy of levoketoconazole in the treatment of endogenous Cushing's syndrome

entities.name: LINC3
synonyms: Safety and efficacy of LCI699 for the treatment of patients with Cushing's disease

entities.name: LINC4
synonyms: Efficacy and safety evaluation of osilodrostat in Cushing's disease

entities.name: GRACE
synonyms: A study of the efficacy and safety of relacorilant in patients with endogenous Cushing syndrome

entities.name: GRADIENT
synonyms: Efficacy and safety of relacorilant in patients with cortisol-secreting adrenal adenomas

evidence_entities.text: Rates of recurrence and/or persistence of Cushing's disease after surgical treatment are high
transsphenoidal pituitary surgery (TSS) is the mainstay of treatment for this disease, up to one-third of the patients eventually relapse
ACTH-secreting tumours express somatostatin receptor 2 (SSTR2) and SSTR5 messenger RNAs (mRNAs) (>85%) and, to a lesser degree, SSTR1 mRNA (63%)
The first randomized phase III clinical trial involving 162 patients with CD treated with subcutaneous pasireotide showed urine-free cortisol (UFC) normalization at month 6 in 15–26% of the patients
levoketoconazole normalized mean urinary free cortisol (mUFC) levels in more than 50% of the patients
osilodrostat resulted in a complete response in 66% and a partial response (≥50% reduction of UFC) in 9% of the enrolled patients
42% and 15% of the patients coming from the low-dose group (200 mg/day) demonstrated a blood pressure reduction of ≥5 mmHg and a glycaemic reduction, respectively
36–62% of corticotroph adenomas show gain-of-function mutations in the gene encoding for USP8

notes: This paper is a comprehensive review of new therapeutic approaches for Cushing's disease, focusing on novel drugs targeting different pathways including pituitary-directed agents, steroidogenesis inhibitors, and immunotherapy approaches.
The paper discusses both approved drugs (pasireotide, levoketoconazole, osilodrostat) and experimental treatments in various stages of clinical development.
Multiple clinical trials are referenced with their specific identifiers and outcomes.
